main event: Radar tracking of an unidentified object over Selfridge AFB, Michigan on 9 March 1950.
interesting points: The object was tracked by radar at speeds up to 1500 mph and altitudes up to 45,000 feet., The object's behavior was described as 'erratic' with rapid changes in altitude and speed., Two pilots, Lt. Francis G. Card and Lt. Homer E. Harris, reported seeing disc-shaped objects and a bright fireball respectively., The radar team observed multiple blips that exceeded the performance of known aircraft., Observers noted that the lights descended and disappeared without leaving a trail.
sighted object: Unidentified object tracked by radar, disc-shaped objects, and a fireball.
witness description: Pilots and radar operators from the military base.
